title: [Large-scale] Web 2.0 Technology-Based Teacher Professional Learning Community Design: Building Social Collaboration Networks

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, understanding of elementary education methodologies, and familiarity with core concepts of socially collaborative learning
context.additional_context: A mixed group of pre-service and in-service elementary school teachers. The course emphasizes competency in utilizing Web 2.0 tools within a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment, focusing on building educational communities and developing capabilities as civic educators. Practical application is supported through collaboration with local educational institutions.

learning_goals: Build a collaborative learning network with peer teachers using Web 2.0 technologies (blogs, wikis, social bookmarks, etc.) and strengthen knowledge-sharing systems across educational communities.
Systematically analyze their teaching practices through Web 2.0-based reflective journaling and improve instructional methods via peer feedback.
Apply Web 2.0-integrated lesson designs developed through project-based assessments to real classroom settings and practice innovative pedagogies responsive to educational system changes.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
